metadata.title: CVE-2020-29363 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: An issue was discovered in p11-kit 0.23.6 through 0.23.21. A heap-based buffer overflow has been discovered in the RPC protocol used by p11-kit server/remote commands and the client library. When the remote entity supplies a serialized byte array in a CK_ATTRIBUTE, the receiving entity may not allocate sufficient length for the buffer to store the deserialized value.

criterions.comment: p11-kit package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.23.22-1').
